source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Portulacaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Portulacaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sepals deciduous before fruit ripens; capsule shining black, tardily dehiscent; leaves obovoid to globular, to c. 1 cm long
Sepals persistent; capsule readily dehiscent; leaves ± linear
Sepals 4 mm long or more; petals at least 7 mm long; valves of capsule acuminate; seeds flattened toward the margin
Sepals less than 4 mm long; petals to 7 mm long; valves of capsule obtuse, incurved; seeds not flattened toward margin
Seeds 1–4 per capsule, 0.7–1 mm diam.; capsule cylindric; flowers more or less clustered
Seeds at least 10 per capsule, 0.4–0.7 mm diam.; capsule ovoid; flowers clearly separated along elongating flowering stems
Seeds ± round, c. 0.7 mm diam., smooth to faintly patterned; plants usually with scattered leaves along branches; fruiting pedicels to c. 1 cm long; capsules to 3.5 (rarely to 4) mm long
Seeds reniform, c. 0.5 mm diam., distinctly granular to papillate; plants often ± leafless above base; fruiting pedicels usually longer than 1 cm; capsules longer than 3.5 mm
Flowering branch straight, never twining; stamens 7–20; fruiting pedicel straight, deflexed; capsule 3–5 mm long; seeds reddish or grey, rarely black
Flowering stems twining; stamens 6–8; fruiting pedicel curved; capsule 5–7 mm long; seeds dark brown to black
